dictionary.definition: the enzyme which "unzips" the original DNA strand
forms the lagging strand because polymerase can only run in the 3' to 5' direction
the stage of the cell cycle in which DNA replication occurs
the enzyme which "glues" the strands together
the enzyme which primes the strands with RNA so polymerase knows where to start
the enzyme which builds the strands
the enyzme which replaces RNA with DNA
a sugar which is pentagon shaped
